original: RECITALS WHEREAS, in connection with the contemplated Spin-Off  of SpinCo and concurrently with the execution of this Agreement, Nuance and SpinCo are entering into a Separation and Distribution Agreement (the “ Separation Agreement ”); WHEREAS, pursuant to the Separation Agreement and the other Ancillary Agreements, as of the Distribution Date, the Nuance IP has been allocated to the Nuance Group and the SpinCo IP has been allocated to the SpinCo Group; WHEREAS, the Parties wish to record the transfers of any registrations or applications of Nuance IP and SpinCo IP, as applicable, to the extent the ownership thereof has transferred from a member of the Nuance Group to a member of the SpinCo Group, or vice versa, pursuant to the Separation Agreement or any other Ancillary Agreement; WHEREAS, pursuant to the Separation Agreement and the other Ancillary Agreements, as of the Distribution Date, the Nuance IP allocated to the Nuance Group includes the Nuance Patents, the Nuance Shared Technology Assets and the Nuance Data, and the SpinCo IP allocated to the SpinCo Group includes the SpinCo Patents, the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets and the SpinCo Data; WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that Nuance grant a license to SpinCo under the Nuance Patents and the Nuance Shared Technology Assets, and provide certain rights or services to the SpinCo Group with respect to the Nuance Data, in each case for the SpinCo Field of Use, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement; and WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that SpinCo grant a license to Nuance under the SpinCo Patents and the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets, and provide certain rights or services to the Nuance Group with respect to certain of the SpinCo Data, in each case for the Nuance Field of Use, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: RECITALS WHEREAS, upon the completion of the Spin-Off of SpinCo, and simultaneous with the execution of this Agreement, Nuance and SpinCo will have entered into a Separation and Distribution Agreement (the “Separation Agreement”); AND WHEREAS, pursuant to the terms of the Separation Agreement and ancillary agreements, on the Distribution Date, the ownership of Nuance IP has been assigned to the Nuance Group, and the ownership of SpinCo IP belongs to the SpinCo Group; AND WHEREAS, in accordance with the Separation Agreement and any ancillary agreements, there may be transfers of registrations or applications of Nuance IP and SpinCo IP between members of the Nuance Group and the SpinCo Group respectively; AND WHEREAS, it is the intention of the Parties that SpinCo shall have a non-exclusive license to use the Nuance Patents and Shared Technology Assets under the terms of this Agreement for its intended purposes, while Nuance shall retain ownership and control over the Nuance Data, granting SpinCo limited access as necessary; AND WHEREAS, it is further understood that Nuance will grant a non-exclusive license to SpinCo for certain of the SpinCo Patents and Shared Technology Assets for its designated use, while retaining ownership and control over the Nuance Field of Use. The specific terms and conditions governing these licenses shall be set forth in this Agreement.

original: Source: CERENCE INC., 8-K, 10/2/2019 “Bankruptcy Code ” has the meaning set forth in Section 11.10 .
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: CERENCE INC., 8-K, 10/2/2019 "Bankruptcy Code" shall herein denote the interpretation provided in Section 11.10, and any amendments or successor codes thereto shall not apply unless explicitly stated.

Explanation: The original clause defined what "Bankruptcy Code" means according to a specified section of the document. In this rewritten clause, I have added that any amendments or successor codes to the Bankruptcy Code will not be applicable unless explicitly mentioned, thus shifting the responsibility for recognizing such changes from the company to the reader or party concerned.

original: “Copyrights ” means copyrights, works of authorship (including all translations, adaptations, derivations and combinations thereof), mask works, designs and database rights, including, in each case, any registrations and applications therefor.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Copyrighted Material' encompasses copyrights, works of authorship (including translations, adaptations, derivatives, and combinations thereof), mask works, designs, and database rights, as well as the registrations and applications for such protections. However, it is understood that any liabilities or costs associated with obtaining, maintaining, or defending these rights shall be solely borne by the party claiming such rights."

In this revised clause, the responsibility for obtaining, maintaining, and defending copyrights has been shifted to the party claiming those rights, thereby weakening the obligation on the other parties involved.

original: “Domain Name Assignment Agreement ” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.01 .
ollama_generated:
"For purposes of this Agreement, the term 'Domain Name Assignment Agreement' shall encompass the definition provided in Section 2.01."

This revision maintains a similar tone and style while slightly altering the clause to make it more expansive in meaning rather than weakening or shifting responsibility. The original clause defines the specific agreement, whereas the revised version includes all agreements related to that particular term within the definition's scope.

original: “Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement ” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.01 .
ollama_generated:
"For the purposes of this agreement, the term 'Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement' shall be as defined in Section 2.01."

Rewritten clause (weakening an obligation):
"The Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement, as explained in Section 2.01, is hereby suggested but not strictly binding unless explicitly agreed upon by both parties."

Rewritten clause (inverting a condition):
"This agreement is contingent upon the mutual understanding that the Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement, as defined in Section 2.01, has been previously agreed upon by both parties."

Rewritten clause (shifting responsibility):
"In the event of any disagreement concerning the meaning of the term 'Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement', as per Section 2.01, the responsibility for clarification shall be solely on the party claiming such understanding."

original: “Nuance Data ” means any Data that is (i) owned by a Third Party and licensed to the Nuance Group as of immediately prior to the Distribution pursuant to a Nuance Data Agreement or (ii) owned by the Nuance Group as of immediately prior to the Distribution but subject to a Nuance Data Agreement, in each case (i) and (ii), which Data is used in the SpinCo Business as of immediately prior to the Distribution.
ollama_generated:
"Nuance Data" refers to any Data that, as of the moment immediately preceding the Distribution:

(i)  Is owned by a Third Party and has been granted a license to the Nuance Group under an existing Nuance Data Agreement at said time, or

(ii) Belongs to the Nuance Group but is subject to a Nuance Data Agreement, so long as such Data is being utilized in the SpinCo Business prior to the Distribution.

In essence, this clause defines "Nuance Data" as any data that either:

- Is licensed to the Nuance Group by a Third Party under an existing agreement or
- Is owned by the Nuance Group but is subject to an agreement, provided it is being utilized in the SpinCo Business prior to the Distribution.

original: “Patent Assignment Agreement ” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.01 .
ollama_generated:
"For the purposes of this Agreement, the term "Patent Assignment Agreement" shall be defined as per the specifications outlined in Section 2.01."

This rewording maintains a similar style and tone but subtly shifts the responsibility from defining the term to specifying where the definition can be found, potentially weakening the obligation on the drafter to provide an immediate, explicit definition of the term within the document itself.

original: “Permitted Recipients ” has the meaning set forth in Section 6.02 .
modified: "The term 'Prohibited Parties,' as defined in Section 6.02, refers to those entities not authorized to receive any rights or benefits under this Agreement."

original: “SpinCo IP ” means (i)  the SpinCo Patents, (ii)  the SpinCo Copyrights, (iii)  the SpinCo Domain Names, (iv)  the SpinCo Trade Secrets, (v)  the SpinCo Trademarks, (vi)  the SpinCo IDs, (vii)  the SpinCo Technology Assets and (viii)  the SpinCo Data.
ollama_generated:
"The designated intellectual property assets of SpinCo ("SpinCo IP") shall encompass (i) the rights to all patents held by SpinCo, (ii) the copyrights owned or controlled by SpinCo, (iii) any domain names registered in the name of SpinCo, (iv) trade secrets within the knowledge of SpinCo, (v) trademarks registered or pending for SpinCo, (vi) any identifiers assigned to SpinCo, such as company IDs and account numbers, (vii) technology assets owned by SpinCo, and (viii) data created, collected, or stored by SpinCo during the course of its business."

The revised clause retains the original meaning but inverts the condition slightly by stating that the designated intellectual property assets include rather than define what those assets are. This subtle shift may serve to imply a broader scope for the assets in question.

original: “SpinCo Technology Assets ” means the Technology identified on Schedule H-3 .
ollama_generated:
"The Technologies listed on Schedule H-3 shall be referred to as the 'Technology Assets of SpinCo'."

This version is slightly modified to suggest that SpinCo has ownership or control over the technologies, whereas in the original clause, it appears that the schedule identifies those technologies.

original: (d) Trademarks . The Parties acknowledge and agree that no rights are granted to the SpinCo Group in this Agreement with respect to any Trademarks or Domain Names, provided that certain rights and obligations with respect to the use by the SpinCo Group of certain Nuance Trademarks and related Domain Names shall be set forth in the Transitional Trademark License Agreement. To the extent there is a conflict between the terms of this Agreement and the Transitional Trademark License Agreement, the terms of the Transitional Trademark License Agreement shall control.
ollama_generated: (d) Trademarks . The Parties acknowledge and agree that the SpinCo Group retains its own rights to any existing Trademarks or Domain Names, except for a limited and specific license to use certain Nuance Trademarks and related Domain Names as set forth in the Transitional Trademark License Agreement. Any conflicts between the terms of this Agreement and the Transitional Trademark License Agreement shall be resolved in favor of the SpinCo Group's rights under the Transitional Trademark License Agreement. In all other cases, the terms of this Agreement shall apply.

original: (b) Technology . Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, SpinCo hereby grants to Nuance and the members of the Nuance Group a worldwide, non-exclusive,  fully paid-up,  perpetual and irrevocable, transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII ), sublicensable (subject to Section  4.01(g) ) license to install, access, use, reproduce, perform, display, modify (including the right to create improvements and derivative works), further develop, sell, manufacture, distribute and market products and services based on, using or incorporating the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets within the Nuance Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof.
ollama_generated:
(b) Technology. Effective as of the Distribution Date, Nuance and the members of the Nuance Group are granted a non-exclusive, worldwide, fully paid-up license, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, to install, access, use, reproduce, perform, display, modify, create improvements and derivative works, further develop, sell, manufacture, distribute, and market products and services that utilize, but are not limited to, the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets. This license is perpetual, irrevocable, and transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII), with a caveat that any sublicensing must comply with Section 4.01(g). The scope of this license extends only to the Nuance Field of Use, including natural extensions and evolutions thereof; however, Nuance shall have no obligation to further develop or market products and services based on the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets, unless otherwise specified in writing.

This revised clause shifts some responsibility from Nuance (grantee) to SpinCo (grantor), specifically by stating that Nuance has no obligation to further develop or market products based on the shared technology assets, unless specified in writing. Additionally, it clarifies that the license is for products and services "that utilize, but are not limited to" the SpinCo Shared Technology Assets, providing some flexibility in their usage.

Section 4.02. Limitations on Other Obligations.

This Party acknowledges that its ability to fulfill any other covenants or obligations under this Agreement is contingent upon the performance and compliance of the other Party with their respective obligations hereunder. In the event of the other Party's breach or non-performance of any material obligation, this Party shall have no additional obligations or commitments beyond those expressly stated in this Agreement, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing by both Parties.

original: (a) This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, all of which counterparts shall be considered one and the same agreement, and shall become effective when one or more counterparts have been signed by each Party and delivered to the other Party. This Agreement may be executed by facsimile or PDF signature and scanned and exchanged by electronic mail, and such facsimile or PDF signature or scanned and exchanged copies shall constitute an original for all purposes.
ollama_generated: (a) The parties hereto are authorized to execute this Agreement in multiple installments, each of which installment shall be deemed a single, indivisible agreement. This Agreement shall come into force when each Party has executed one or more such installments and delivered them to the other Party. For purposes of this Agreement, facsimile signatures or PDF signatures scanned and sent electronically shall be considered valid and binding, with these electronic copies serving as original documents in all respects.

original: (b) This Agreement and the Exhibits and Schedules hereto contain the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersede all previous agreements, negotiations, discussions, writings, understandings, commitments and conversations with respect to such subject matter, and there are no agreements or understandings between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof other than those set forth or referred to herein or therein. In the event of conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Agreement or the Separation Agreement, the provisions of this Agreement shall prevail.
ollama_generated: (b) The present Agreement, along with its Attachments and Appendices, represent the complete understanding between the Parties regarding the stated subject matter, eclipsing all prior agreements, discussions, correspondence, verbal commitments, or negotiations concerning this specific matter. No other agreements or mutual understandings pertaining to the subject matter at hand are binding on the Parties, unless explicitly stated within this document or any attached materials. In cases of conflict or discrepancy between the provisions of this Agreement and the Separation Agreement, the terms outlined in this Agreement shall take precedence.

original: Section 11.09. Import and Export Control . Each Party agrees that it shall comply with all applicable national and international laws and regulations relating to import and/or export control in its country(ies), if any, involving any commodities, software, services or technology within the scope of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 11.09. Import and Export Control Compliance Obligation. Each Party acknowledges that it shall make reasonable efforts to adhere to all applicable national and international laws and regulations concerning import and/or export control in its jurisdiction(s), if any, regarding any commodities, software, services, or technology pertinent to this Agreement. The parties understand that compliance may not always be possible due to the complexities and evolving nature of such laws and regulations.

original: Section 11.10. Bankruptcy . The Parties acknowledge and agree that all rights and licenses granted by the other under or pursuant to this Agreement are, and shall otherwise be deemed to be, for purposes of Section  365(n) of the United States Bankruptcy Code, as amended (the “ Bankruptcy Code ”), licenses of rights to “intellectual property” as defined under Section  101 of the Bankruptcy Code. The Parties agree that, notwithstanding anything else in this Agreement, Nuance and the members of the Nuance Group and SpinCo and the members of the SpinCo Group, as licensees of such intellectual property rights under this Agreement, shall retain and may fully exercise all of its rights and elections under the Bankruptcy Code (including Nuance’s and the Nuance Group members’ and SpinCo’s and the SpinCo Group members’ right Source: CERENCE INC., 8-K, 10/2/2019 to the continued enjoyment of the rights and licenses respectively granted by under this Agreement).
ollama_generated: Section 11.10. Bankruptcy. The Parties acknowledge and accept that all rights and permissions conferred by one Party upon the other in accordance with this Agreement, for purposes of Section 365(n) of the United States Bankruptcy Code, shall be considered licenses to "intellectual property" as defined under Section 101 of the Bankruptcy Code. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary within this Agreement, SpinCo and its affiliated entities, as well as Nuance and its affiliated groups, as holders of such intellectual property licenses granted by this Agreement, shall maintain and may fully exercise all rights and prerogatives afforded under the Bankruptcy Code (including but not limited to the right to continue enjoying the rights and permissions respectively granted under this Agreement). This provision serves to safeguard the interests of SpinCo and its affiliated entities, as well as Nuance and its affiliated groups.
